comment.body: Now that is pretty neat. I'm guessing Kaffeine has a backend for scraping data and isn't just magic?
This is an intriguing question for me as I have no answer. I love Rust for when I need fast and safe code or Javascript for when I need fast prototyping or want something people can use easily.
Accidental enter. That said, I switch languages a lot and might pick languages I detest (like C++) when it's required or just makes sense.
@Kaffie: Oi, don't you diss functional or esoteric languages. Because I made one that's both ( https://github.com/JaniM/Joe ). :DNo, but seriously

No, but seriously, how do you add a newline? >.> Anyways, functional programming has a place in my heart. It's wonderful when you get into it - just the programs are inherently slower. And about OOP: it works if you have minimal inheritance and favor composition (see: Rust).

@Ivesen: shift+enter doesn't work and I don't see an option to edit anywhere.
Edit: I found it.. :P
Worth mentioning there's a bunch of darknet/free internet rooms in Matrix. E.g. #openweb:disroot.org and #darknet:chat.weho.st - much nicer to use actual open software for something like this.
